page.title: 03OUR VILLAGE OF BLAGDON
page.content: Blagdon is a village of about{400 houses. It is situated on the{Mendip {Hills.}These are famous, because in the last war people lit lights on the top to try to stop the Germans bombing Bristol.{Blagdon Lake}is also famous for its{trout}which are bred in the hatchery and{exported around the {world.}The lake was man made in{1904. The village has four pubs, two bed and breakfast places, a hairdresser, a butcher, two banks, a general store, a doctor's surgery, a post office, a paper shop, and two estate agents. We also have a fire station and used to have a police station, where the policeman still lives with his family. There are three churches in the village, a Baptist Chapel, a Methodist Chapel, and the Parish Church of St.Andrew.
